DLV
Class ImportDirective

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--DLV.ODBCDirective
        |
        +--DLV.ImportDirective
All Implemented Interfaces:
Directive
public class ImportDirective
extends ODBCDirective

This class represents an ImportDirective.

- #import(databasename,username,password,"query",predname).
Definition:
Command #import retrieves data from a table "row by row" through a SQL query specified by the user, and creates one atom per each selected tuple. The name of the imported atoms is set to predname, and define a part of the EDB program. Further EDB predicates can be added by creating text files to feed into DLV. 

    Example 1.
The following is a program which connects to a database via ODBC, reads all of the  data from the table employee and stores them as facts (EDB program) with predicate name emp.
The database name is postgres, access is granted to the user intrieri with password dlv.

 #import(postgres,intrieri,dlv ,"SELECT FROM employee",emp)

Version:
2.0
Author:
Francesco Ricca
See Also:

                       java.lang.String predicateName,
                       java.lang.String conversionType)
Build a new ImportDirective.

Parameters:
databaseName - The name of a database Ex. postgres.
userName - The username in the DBMS.
password - The password associated with "username".
query - An SQL query.
predicateName - The name of the correspondig predicate.
conversionType - a String which allows to specify how to convert column values.
